title: How do you ensure seamless integration between cloud platforms in hybrid cloud environments?

content:
A hybrid cloud environment integrates public cloud, private cloud, and on-premises infrastructure, with the key being to ensure uninterrupted connectivity between platforms. Its importance lies in enhancing business flexibility, cost optimization, and resilience, and it is commonly used in applications such as disaster recovery and cross-cloud workload distribution, enabling enterprises to dynamically respond to demands.

The core elements to ensure seamless integration include standardized network interconnection (such as VPN or SD-WAN), consistent API management, unified identity authentication, and security policies. It features container orchestration (such as Kubernetes) and cloud service meshes, applied in data synchronization and cloud bursting scenarios, significantly improving operational efficiency and portability.

Implementation steps: 1. Evaluate platform compatibility and select interfaces, 2. Deploy hybrid cloud management tools (such as Azure Arc), 3. Standardize APIs and monitoring systems. Typical scenarios include elastic resource scaling, bringing business values such as reduced costs, enhanced agility, and compliance.
